title: Why don't artists who can't write good lyrics hire someone to do it for them? - Quora

response.answer_text: They absolutely do. Check the song credits to a lot of popular songs and you'll see the artists name, plus others. This can sometimes be misleading though. I remember an interview on tv about the songwriters to wrote one of Victoria Beckham's songs. They were bemoaning the fact that she changed a single word from something like “honey” to “baby” and forced her way into the writing credits. I imagine this happens a fair bit, but I have no experience in the music industry. Please comment if you do!

They don’t think that the additional financial benefit from more professional lyrics would be great enough to justify sharing the royalties with an additional contributor. And I suppose they can draw support for their attitude from many successful songs that have lousy lyrics.
